meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The bird would wheeple loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent2: I heard the kettle wheeple as it boiled.
meanings.sent3: The mouse wheepled in surprise when it saw the cat.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the branches wheeple like a chorus of tiny voices.
meanings.sent5: The child's laughter wheepled through the playground.

meanings.sent1: The wheeple of the whistle pierced the air.
meanings.sent2: The sudden wheeple startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent3: The wheeple of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent4: The wheeple of the teapot signaled that the water was ready.
meanings.sent5: The wheeple of the flute echoed through the hall.

meanings.definition: The act of making a high-pitched, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The wheeple of the car brakes made everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent2: The wheeple of the microphone feedback interrupted the speech.
meanings.sent3: The wheeple of the toy train delighted the children.
meanings.sent4: The wheeple of the old door hinges added a spooky atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The wheeple of the excited puppy filled the room with joy.
